problem: The function $f(x) = -3x^2 + 36x - 7,$ defined for all real numbers, does not have an inverse.  However, when its domain is restricted to $x \in [c,\infty),$ the function does become invertible, for certain values of $c.$  What is the smallest such value of $c$?
solution: We can complete the square, to get $f(x) = 101 - 3(x - 6)^2.$  Thus, the graph of $f(x)$ is a parabola with axis of symmetry $x = 6,$ so the smallest possible value of $c$ is $\boxed{6}.$
